Name: Cause to Fight for
Description:
Jiyan sends a message from his post far on the frontline, which seems to concern something important...

Unlock a new Companion after completing this quest.
QuestDesc:
Jiyan sends a message from his post far on the frontline, which seems to concern something important...

Unlock a new Companion after completing this quest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, it's been a while.

Options.PlotLineKey: Jiyan? Did something happen on the front lines?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'm not calling you for work this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have contained the hatching Threnodian. Any new threat from the Tacet Discords will likely take time to materialize.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wouldn't have been possible without you, {PlayerName}. Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Moon-Chasing Festival near and our borders secured, I've granted leave for soldiers who haven't taken any in too long. They deserve time with loved ones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will remain on post with the rest to ensure continued safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That reminds me... Some of the soldiers on leave have lost their families to Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure how they'll spend this time or if they need help. Maybe I will...

Options.PlotLineKey: No need. You can count on me.
I'll go check on them for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... *smile* Then I'll gladly accept your help, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's you, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you here for "Swim, Gulpuff, Swim"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Oh, not really… So this is the stall for that Gulpuff game? My apologies. My eyes aren't as sharp as they used to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My son is a Resonator. He might like this, I guess...

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. He's a Midnight Ranger. They gave him a few day off. When he comes back, I plan to visit the Moonlit Fair with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Old Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, I'm sure he'll have a lot of fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yanwu! You're back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yanwu! Where are the yummies you promised last time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no! I totally forgot…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph! You liar!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hahaha, just kidding! I got you some Loong Buns from the Moonlit Fair. Eat them while they're hot, they're the best that way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow! Loong Buns! Thank you, Yanwu!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C-can I go to the Moonlit Fair too...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! Just let Auntie know and you can go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hooray!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Count me in! Come on, Lele! Let's go find Auntie!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The children run off with Loong Buns, playfully chasing each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take it easy, kids! Watch your step!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh hey, {PlayerName}! I remember seeing you during the last battle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What brings you here? Thought you'd be at the Moonlit Fair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explain why you're here to Yanwu.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. General Jiyan was thoughtful to send you, but there's no need for that. I'm doing great. He worries too much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I grew up in the orphanage nearby. Autie Director takes care of us like her own. The orphanage is my home now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not lonely at all. Look, my family's right here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all orphans like me. Whenever I get leave, I stop by to catch up with them and chat with Auntie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It gives me a sense of purpose, knowing I'm out there on the front lines fighting those monsters to protect them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help? Nah, nothing comes to mind. Maybe repainting the orphanage walls...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But nevermind, I can knock that out in an hour, tops!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for coming over to check on me, {PlayerName}! It means a ton.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yanwu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, time for me to get cracking. See you around!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hello, {PlayerName}. Are you visiting someone you know?

Options.PlotLineKey: I am here for something else.
...No, I don't know any of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... These graves hold fallen soldiers from before your arrival in Jinzhou. You probably don't know them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all soldiers who gave their lives in battles, protecting Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The name on the grave marker in front of Ke Ni catches your eye—that surname is the same as hers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's my brother's grave. He served in the Rearguard. During a transport mission, his team... ran into an ambush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They fulfilled their duty, forming a human barricade to protect the carts from those monsters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the time reinforcements came... it was too late. None of them survived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'm sure he'd be happy to hear that from Jinzhou's savior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way... What brought you here today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explain why you're here to Ke Ni.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I see. That does sound like something General Jiyan would say. Thanks for offering to help. Hmm, let me think...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you don't mind, could you fetch some Lemongrass for me? My brother loved its scent, despite not being a fan of flowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... It smells refreshing as always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reminds me of when mom was alive... She always used Lemongrass in her fish soup. It wasn't the best, to be honest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lemon grass and fish created a weird taste that I couldn't quite put my finger on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she insisted it would make us taller. I couldn't handle it, so I'd pour mine into my brother's bowl. Well, he did grow really tall…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess he loved Lemongrass because it reminded him of simpler, happier times...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, {PlayerName}. I got carried away talking about my family... Haha, now I'm starting to miss my mom's fish soup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you brought me so much Lemongrass, I'll make that fish soup during my leave!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ke Ni
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It'll probably taste worse since I'm eating alone though. Oh well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You here for some sight-seeing too, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I know you're not. Ain't nobody got as much free time as me during days like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, no worries. Just a scratch from a few days back. It's all patched up now.

Options.PlotLineKey: You don't seem to be enjoying your leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The leave... If I was a rookie, I'd be over the moon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about it. Leave's all about food and friends and family reunions for most people, I bet.

Options.PlotLineKey: You can go do all of that too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, EVERYONE…

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can, you say... Huh.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My village got swallowed up by the Waveworn, sunk right into the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like a stone skippin' on water, a few ripples and poof, gone for good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Friends, family, everything I ever loved... vanished in a blink.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had no idea what to do, but I wanted to live.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then along came Jiyan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, you know what that fool... ahem, I mean General Jiyan did? He tried to recruit me! Asked if I wanted to help combat the Tacet Discords. Funny, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As if that'll make a difference... Tacet Discords and the Waveworn stuff, those are natural disasters. They just happen. What can I even do about it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I said yes anyway. He made it sound real good. Figured dying on the battlefield beats starving in the wild.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, you've heard it all. You should know my answer now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do I know what you're gonna ask? Well, Jiyan's been asking us the same darn question every leave!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And my answer stays the same—thanks but no thanks! I'm good being alone. As long as there's still Tacet Discords to fight. Keeps my fists busy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, now go. Oh, and take this with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jiyan never seems to stop working. He keeps skipping meals once he gets busy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me and the boys made this stew with what we've gathered. He can have some.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ningwei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, no sneakin' bites! Well, maybe a nibble, but leave some for Jiyan, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discord remains contained to Norfall Barren. We should consider pushing our outpost positions further north.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deploy new observation posts on the outskirts. This will give us early warnings and time to ready for future outbreaks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Messenger
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roger that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The messenger salutes and hurries away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what brings you here? Aren't you supposed to be in Taoyuan Vale?

Options.PlotLineKey: Came back from one of the soldiers you mentioned. Wanted to check on you too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. It's got to be Ningwei and his crew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told them to make the most of their leave... But they won't stray far from camp, even after years on the front lines.

Options.PlotLineKey: Because they already consider it home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... They must have told you a lot, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: They have a gift for you too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A gift? Could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You set the bowl of stew in front of Jiyan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, knew it. Ningwei made it, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He probably mentioned how I recruited him, but I bet he didn't tell you the whole story.

Options.PlotLineKey: I love stories. Tell me more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wasn't the general back then. Just another medic on duty, returning to base after dark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Made a stew for myself with whatever I had. That's when I saw Ningwei wandering alone in the wilderness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He lost everything in a Waveworn disaster. He was all alone, didn't know what to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shared my stew and listened as he talked about his struggles. About what happened after his hometown was gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His eyes were filled with hopelessness. He wanted to live, but couldn't find a reason to go on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You already know what happened next. I asked if he'd want to enlist in the army. He said yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that, Ningwei often makes stews to share with me during his leaves. Maybe to repay me for the stew from that night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Nevermind, he's probably just showing off his cooking skills. Mine are lacking, to say the least.

Options.PlotLineKey: Nice story. Your stew is getting cold, though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ah, thanks for the reminder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiyan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we eat together, {PlayerName}? You must be hungry, having walked all the way here.
